main event: A witness observed a bright, silverish, translucent object with a buzzing noise over Los Angeles, California on October 10, 1961.
interesting points: The object appeared to have a beam of light and was larger than a star, with greater intensity.
The object moved in an unusual manner, appearing to stand still at times and suddenly speeding up and disappearing.
The witness described the object as having no known form or shape of any known object, but with the appearance of a flying, lighted object.
The object was observed for approximately 2 hours and 5 minutes through a window, with the witness noting changes in brightness and the object disappearing and reappearing.
The witness, a retired U.S. Air Force member, had a light to moderate interest in unidentified flying objects and had experienced a few previous sightings.
sighted object: bright, silverish, translucent object with a buzzing noise
witnesses: 1 witness, a retired U.S. Air Force member
